intro: Chamaelirium japonicum var. koshikiense, commonly known as the Japanese chamaelirium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to Japan and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
